subject: Law
title: Homicide: Murder vs. Manslaughter
description: One-minute skill: Homicide: Murder vs. Manslaughter.

hook.text: Both involve killing someone. But a planned assassination and a bar fight gone wrong carry very different charges.

buildup.text: Murder requires malice aforethoughtâ€”intent to kill or extreme recklessness showing disregard for human life.

discovery.text: Manslaughter lacks that intent. Voluntary manslaughter involves provocation; involuntary involves negligence.

twist.text: First-degree murder requires premeditation. Second-degree is intentional but not planned in advance.

climax.text: The same death can lead to vastly different sentences depending on the killer's mental state.

punchline.text: In homicide law, intent is everything.

quiz.question: What separates murder from voluntary manslaughter?
